faqs.question: Is the amount paid go wasted incase no calamity occurred.?
faqs.answer: Thousands of farmers die every year in our country because they are not able to get any claim for their damaged crops as they haven’t insured on the crops. The purpose of this scheme is to save those farmers. So even if the person for whom you have paid the premium haven’t faced an adverse situation to claim that, it still means you have provided backing for a person at the most needed hour.

faqs.question: What proof will be given on paying the amount.?
faqs.answer: Upon making the payment, you will be given a receipt with a transaction id and other details, which you can use for further and once premium is paid you will get proof for premium paid

faqs.question: What are the options available for transferring the premium amount.?
faqs.answer: Any person willing to pay the premium amount for one/more farmer can transfer the amount  through internet banking/cheque/demand draft to the NGO or connect to the farmer and pay the premium and update in system

faqs.question: What is the role of an FEF.?
faqs.answer: An FEF have to educate the farmer about the crop insurance scheme and assist him/her in filling up the form. An FEF should also be able to help the farmer in future with any technical aid needed.

faqs.question: How can become a FEF.?
faqs.answer: ou can login to the “url” and register yourself as an FEF. faqs.question: How can I track the status of the premium paid.?
faqs.answer: You can opt for a notification, in that case an update will be sent to your registered email in each stage of processing.If you do not want that option, you can still login to the portal and search with the transaction id given in your receipt to view the current status of the premium
